image_1.description: A young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert, wearing a blue and purple coat with a flower on his chest, holding a sword.

image_2.description: A yellow snake with red eyes and fangs, coiled around a mouse, similar to the boa constrictor described in 'True Stories from Nature'.

image_3.description: A light brown, wide-brimmed hat, which the grown-ups mistakenly believe is what the narrator's Drawing Number One represents, instead of a boa constrictor digesting an elephant.

image_4.description: The elephant is mentioned by the Little Prince when he rejects one of the narrator's drawings, stating he does not want an elephant inside a boa constrictor. It is also depicted in a simple line drawing showing a trunk, large ears, and four legs.

image_5.description: A young boy with blonde hair, wearing a blue and purple coat with a white shirt and pants, holding a sword. The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. He is also known for asking the narrator to draw him a sheep.

image_6.description: A drawing of a lamb with fluffy wool, standing on all fours, facing forward with its head slightly turned to the side, which is the subject the Little Prince asks the narrator to draw, becoming a central theme in their interactions.

image_7.description: A drawing of a goat with a fluffy coat, small horns, and a tail. The goat is standing on all fours and appears to be facing the viewer, as described in the interactions between the Little Prince and the narrator.

image_8.description: A small, white lamb with a fluffy coat and a smiling expression, which is the subject of the Little Prince's request to the narrator to draw.

image_9.description: A simple, rectangular box with three circular holes on its top surface, which is part of the drawing made by the narrator for the Little Prince, representing the sheep.

image_10.description: A young boy with yellow hair, wearing a green outfit and a red bow tie, standing on a small planet. The Little Prince is a mysterious small person who appears in the desert and asks the narrator to draw him a sheep.
A small, round planet with a few flowers and cracks on its surface. The planet the Little Prince came from was scarcely any larger than a house, and is believed to be the asteroid known as B-612.

image_11.description: A person wearing a hat and a coat, sitting on a stool with a stethoscope around their neck, possibly representing the narrator who had an accident in the Sahara and encounters the little prince, attempting to draw a sheep for him.

image_12.description: An elderly man with a white beard, wearing a white robe and an orange hat, pointing at a board, who is likely the narrator of the story, Antoine de Saint-Exupery, drawing and explaining to the Little Prince.

image_13.description: A man dressed in a white suit with a bow tie, pointing at a board, who is likely the narrator of the story, Antoine de Saint-Exupery, drawing and explaining to the Little Prince.

image_15.description: The titular character of the story, a young boy with golden hair, wearing a green outfit, holding a shovel and working on a small planet. He is from another planet and the Narrator encounters him in the desert. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.

A small, round planet covered in flowers and surrounded by stars, infested with baobabs, and serves as a setting to illustrate the dangers of neglecting responsibilities. It is the home of the Little Prince and the Rose, representing a place of innocence and the starting point of the Little Prince's journey.
A root of a plant that The Little Prince is digging up with his shovel, representing the maintenance and discipline required to control the baobabs on his planet.

Yellow stars surrounding the planet, symbolizing the vastness of the universe and the homes of the flowers that the Little Prince cares about, representing the grandeur and the smallness of individual concerns.

image_16.description: The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery. A young boy dressed in red, standing on a tree branch and holding a stick.

The Baobabs are a type of bad plant on the Little Prince's planet that can grow into huge trees and destroy the entire planet if not controlled, symbolizing the importance of discipline and timely action. A large, white and brown striped creature with multiple tentacles and a dark mouth, emerging from the tree, representing the baobabs.

image_17.description: The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. A young boy with curly hair, wearing a cape, sitting on a chair and looking at the horizon.

Asteroid B-612 is the home planet of the little prince, described as being scarcely bigger than himself, with flowers and a single plant with a large bud. It is infested with baobabs, which are invasive trees that can cause significant damage if not controlled.

image_18.description: A red flower with a long green stem and leaves, positioned in front of a yellow circle, representing fragility, beauty, and the things that are important but often overlooked in the story.

image_19.description: A boy with curly hair, wearing a long-sleeved shirt and pants, standing on a small hill. Also known as 'The Little Prince', the titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert.

A small hill with a single flower growing on it. Also known as 'The Planet', the home of the Little Prince and the Rose, representing a place of innocence and the starting point of the Little Prince's journey.

A single flower with a round bloom, growing on the hill. Also known as 'The Rose', a unique flower on the Little Prince's planet, which becomes significant to him and a source of his emotional attachment.

image_20.description: The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. A young boy with blonde hair, wearing a green outfit and a scarf, watering a rose. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.
A unique flower on the Little Prince's planet, which becomes significant to him and a source of his emotional attachment. A small red flower being watered by The Little Prince.

The home of the Little Prince and the Rose, representing a place of innocence and the starting point of the Little Prince's journey. A small gray planet where The Little Prince is standing and watering the rose.

image_22.description: A young boy with golden hair, wearing a green outfit and a long green scarf, kneeling on the ground. The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.

A small red rose with a single stem and leaf, located to the left of The Little Prince. The Rose is a unique flower on the Little Prince's planet, which becomes significant to him and a source of his emotional attachment.

image_23.description: The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery. A young boy with spiky hair, wearing a light-colored shirt and pants, standing on one leg.
The Glass Globe is a shelter that the Little Prince prepares for the Flower to protect her from the cold. A small stool with a round seat and three legs, used as a shelter for the flower.

image_24.description: A young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. He is characterized by his curly hair, blue outfit, and yellow sword. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.
The Little Prince's home planet, where he takes care of the flower and maintains the volcanoes. It is a small, round planet with a few scattered flowers and a single rose.
A unique red rose with green leaves, located on the Little Prince's planet. It becomes significant to him and a source of his emotional attachment.

image_25.description: A king wearing a crown, a red cape with stars, and a white robe with stars. He is sitting on a purple throne with a floral pattern, claiming to rule over everything, including planets and stars, and is encountered by the Little Prince.

image_26.description: A clown with a red nose, wearing a yellow suit and hat, standing on top of the Earth, as depicted in the story of 'The Little Prince'.

image_27.description: An elderly man with a red nose and white beard, wearing a brown hat and a gray coat, sitting at a table. This character is likely 'The Tippler', who drinks to forget his shame of drinking, representing a cycle of addiction.

image_28.description: A bald man, possibly symbolizing the businessman, wearing a white shirt, red and white striped tie, and green vest. He is sitting at a desk with papers in front of him, appearing to be deep in thought or reading, preoccupied with counting stars and claiming ownership over them.

image_29.description: The Lamplighter is a character on a small planet who follows orders to light and extinguish a street lamp, finding his work meaningful despite its repetitive nature. He is bound by orders to light and extinguish his lamp every minute due to the rapid rotation of his planet, leaving him no time to rest.

image_30.description: An elderly man with a white beard, wearing a green robe and hat, sitting at a table, who is likely the geographer described in the text.

image_31.description: The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery. A boy with orange hair, wearing a brown jacket over a yellow shirt and brown pants, pointing at something.
A bright yellow sun in the sky with rays extending outward, which is a significant event on the Lamplighter's planet, occurring 1440 times a day.
A patterned ground with intersecting lines, which is part of the Earth's diverse geography.

image_32.description: A young boy with curly golden hair, wearing a green outfit, standing on a barren landscape. The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.
A barren and uninhabited area of Earth where the Little Prince finds himself, symbolizing loneliness and the absence of human contact. The desert is also where the Little Prince encounters the snake.

image_33.description: A vast, sandy desert landscape with rolling hills, where the Little Prince finds himself, symbolizing loneliness and the absence of human contact.
Two vibrant orange flowers growing from the sand, representing a brief encounter and a source of information about humans for the Little Prince.

image_34.description: A high mountain range that the Little Prince climbs in an attempt to see the whole planet and its people, symbolizing his quest for understanding and companionship. The highest point of a mountain range, with a person standing on top, and a series of mountains with sharp and jagged peaks.

image_35.description: A young boy with golden hair, wearing a gray outfit with a belt and a yellow scarf, from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.

A garden where the Little Prince discovers many roses, all looking like his own flower, leading to a realization about the uniqueness and value of his own rose back home, located to the left of The Little Prince.

image_36.description: A young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert, wearing a green outfit and purple shoes, lying on the ground covered in small pink flowers. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.

image_37.description: A young boy with golden hair, wearing a green outfit with a long scarf, standing on a grassy hill, and the titular character of the story from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert.

An orange fox with a bushy tail, sitting on the grass near the Little Prince, and a wise fox that the Little Prince meets, who teaches him about the importance of establishing ties and the concept of taming.

image_38.description: A small, brown rabbit standing at the entrance of a burrow.

image_39.description: A central water fountain with a curved basin and a spout from which water flows, symbolizing the fulfillment of a quest in the story.

image_40.description: The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. A young boy with orange hair, wearing a green outfit and holding a cane, standing next to a well. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.

A stone well with a wooden pulley system, located in a desert landscape. This well is significant in the story where the narrator and the Little Prince find water, symbolizing the fulfillment of a quest.

A sandy desert with sparse vegetation, including a few palm trees and rocks. The desert is the geographical location where the narrator and the Little Prince search for a well, symbolizing a challenging environment and holding a sense of mystery and enchantment, symbolizing the hidden beauty of invisible things.

image_41.description: The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. A young boy with golden hair, wearing a green outfit and a yellow scarf, sitting on the edge of a large rock. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.
A barren desert landscape with sparse vegetation and rocks, symbolizing the hidden beauty of invisible things. The desert is a geographical location that holds a sense of mystery and enchantment.

A small, yellow snake standing upright on the ground below the rock. A creature of concern for the Little Prince, as it poses a potential threat to the Narrator and is mentioned in the context of their final meeting.

image_42.description: The titular character of the story, a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert. He is characterized by his curly hair, wearing a necklace and pants, and standing with arms crossed. Also refers to the narrative event that unfolds as the story of the book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.

image_43.description: The boy, also known as 'The Little Prince', is a character who is afraid yet able to laugh and shares a deep connection with the narrator, discussing the significance of laughter, friendship, and the stars. He is a young boy from another planet who the Narrator encounters in the desert, wearing a long-sleeved shirt and pants, with spiky hair, sitting on the ground with one arm extended and the other resting on his knee.

The star in the sky, positioned above and to the right of the boy, is significant to the Little Prince as it is associated with his home and is mentioned in relation to the time of his arrival on Earth and his eventual departure. The narrator associates this star with the Little Prince and listens to it at night, like five hundred million little bells.

image_44.description: The Little Prince is a character who is afraid, yet able to laugh and shares a deep connection with the narrator, discussing the significance of laughter, friendship, and the stars. A small, yellow-haired boy dressed in a yellow outfit with blue shoes, standing on a planet and looking up.

The Star is significant to the Little Prince as it is associated with his home and is mentioned in relation to the time of his arrival on Earth and his eventual departure. A single, bright star located above the Little Prince.

image_45.description: A small, gray star located in the upper right portion of the image, significant to the Little Prince as it is associated with his home and is mentioned in relation to the time of his arrival on Earth and his eventual departure.
